DOC.brief_summary: This study test feasibility difference contact lens wettability measure wavefront sensor .
DOC.brief_title: Assessment Contact Lens Wettability Using Wavefront Aberrometry
DOC.criteria: 1 . Healthy male female least 18 40 year age . 2 . The subject must read , understand , sign Statement Informed Consent receive fully execute copy form . 3 . The subject must appear able willing adhere instruction set forth clinical protocol . 4 . The subject must possess wearable pair spectacle distance vision correction provide satisfactory vision . 5 . The subject current spherical soft contact lens wearer ( define minimum 6 hour lens wear per week minimum 1 month prior study ) sufficient prior experience soft contact lens wear ( define minimum 30 day lens wear last 5 year ) . 6 . The subject 's vertexed best sphere distance refraction must 0.75 5.00 D eye . 7 . Cylinder refraction less equal 0.75 D eye ( axis ) . 8 . The subject must correct visual acuity 20/20 good eye . 1 . Currently pregnant lactating ( subject become pregnant study discontinue ) . 2 . Any ocular systemic allergy disease may interfere contact lens wear . 3 . Any systemic disease , autoimmune disease , use medication , may interfere contact lens wear . 4 . Any known hypersensitivity allergic reaction contact lens solution sodium fluorescein dye . 5 . Any previous ocular intraocular surgery ( e.g . radial keratotomy , PRK , LASIK , etc . ) 6 . Current wearer rigid hybrid contact lens . 7 . Entropion , ectropion , extrusion , chalazia , recurrent stye , glaucoma , history recurrent corneal erosion , aphakia , moderate corneal distortion keratometry . 8 . Infectious disease ( e.g . hepatitis , tuberculosis ) immunosuppressive disease ( e.g . HIV ) . 9 . History binocular vision abnormality strabismus . 10 . Employee investigational clinic ( e.g . Investigator , Coordinator , Technician ) . 11 . Clinically significant ( grade 3 4 ) corneal edema , pterygium , corneal vascularization , corneal staining , abnormality cornea conjunctiva may interfere study measurement . 12 . Strabismus , suppression amblyopia . 13 . Any ocular infection .
